text.more: As part of my School of Information capstone project for spring 2019, I was tasked with digitizing 425 photographs from boxes 14 and 15 of the collection and creating a visualization to show relationships among the photographers and subjects. The project entailed digitizing photographs, creating image derivatives, creating and implementing metadata, creating the visualization using Gephi, and publishing it online using Github.
text.intro: This visualization depicts the relationships between Mexican photographers and their subjects during the War of Reform and the French Intervention in Mexico. text.title: Visualizing the 19th-century Mexican Political Sphere
